elements.name: disclaimer
elements.title:
"Choose How to Attend Your Traffic Hearing" is a service provided by the Government of British Columbia.

The Government of British Columbia has the right to change this service at any time.
  • Learn more about the disclaimer and liability here. (This link opens in a new tab)
  • Learn more about privacy and security here. (This link opens in a new tab)
The Provincial Court of British Columbia will look at your choice. The Court will decide how you will attend your Traffic Hearing.

By pressing "Continue," you are agreeing to these terms.

elements.name: hearingAttendanceDocumentation
elements.body:
This is documentation for 2 setVariable triggers that create a variable called {hearingAttendance}. These triggers can be accessed via: Survey Settings>Logic

These triggers were created in order for the PDF to generate the correct signature block. 

Originally, we wanted to visually preserve the requests that the disputant made. If someone chose a remote hearing without having phone nor video capabilities, this service would show them an explanation that the signature block for in-person would appear at the end of this service. 

However, the PDF generation code did not recognize this scenario and rendered the wrong signature block (for a remote hearing) in the PDF. 

The PDF generation code read from the variable {hearingAttendance}. Rather than change the selection of the old {hearingAttendance} element upon this rare condition, the element was renamed to {hearingAttendanceRequest} to visually preserve the original choices of the disputant and without the need to change the PDF generation code.

elements.name: schedulingInfoPanel
schedulingInfoExplanation
elements.title:
The next few questions are about extra needs for your Traffic Hearing.

English and French are the official languages. English is the language that is spoken in Traffic Hearings.

You can ask for your Traffic Hearing to be in French.

You can ask for an interpreter to help you with English at your Traffic Hearing. The government will pay for the interpreter. You cannot bring your own interpreter.

elements.description: The government will pay for the interpreter. You cannot bring your own interpreter.

elements.name: interpreterLanguage
elements.title: What language(s) are you comfortable speaking?
elements.description: Include any dialect(s) you are comfortable speaking. For example, instead of "Chinese," write "Cantonese," "Mandarin," or another dialect.

elements.name: witnesses
elements.title: Will you be asking Witnesses to attend your Traffic Hearing?
elements.description: Witnesses are people (other than yourself) who saw what happened when you were given your Violation Ticket.

elements.name: witnessesFAQ
elements.title: How do I prepare my witnesses for my Traffic Hearing?
elements.body:
You will need to provide your witnesses with documents related to your Traffic Hearing before it starts.

The Court will administer the oath or affirmation for each witness. If your witness wants to swear an oath on a religious text, you must make sure they have the religious text they want before your Traffic Hearing starts.

elements.name: witnessesAmount
elements.title: How many Witnesses do you plan on asking to attend your Traffic Hearing?

elements.name: exhibits
elements.title: Will you be showing Exhibits to your Traffic Hearing?
elements.description: Examples of Exhibits are a doctor's note, police report, photograph, video (dash cam), or other documents.

elements.name: exhibitsYesExplanation
elements.title: For now, the Court cannot review Exhibits video. If you have Exhibits to show/present/bring, you may have to attend Traffic Hearing in person.

elements.name: exhibitTypes
elements.title: List the Exhibits you plan to present/show/bring?
elements.description: Lots to discuss here about what to show the disputant, what information they need, and what appears on the form for the VTC.

elements.name: exhibitsFAQ
elements.title: Can I show Exhibits by video?
elements.body:
You can share your screen using Microsoft Teams to show documents during your Traffic Hearing. You may only share your screen if directed to do so by the Court.

You will get instructions on how to share you screen.

If you have a large number of documents to show during your Traffic Hearing, you may provide advance copies to the Court by email.

Please contact the Violation Ticket Centre at 1-877-661-8026 for more information.
